register.reg_long_name: Performance Monitors Count Enable Clear register
register.reg_condition: when AArch32 is supported at any Exception level and PMUv3 is implemented

purpose_text.para: Disables the Cycle Count Register, PMCCNTR, and any implemented event counters PMEVCNTR<n>. Reading this register shows which counters are enabled.
PMCNTENCLR is used in conjunction with the PMCNTENSET register.

field_description.para: PMCCNTR disable bit. Disables the cycle counter register. Possible values are:

field_value_description.para: When read, means the cycle counter is disabled. When written, has no effect.
When read, means the cycle counter is enabled. When written, disables the cycle counter.

field_description.para: Event counter disable bit for PMEVCNTR<n>.

If N is less than 31, then bits [30:N] are RAZ/WI. When EL2 is implemented and enabled in the current Security state, in EL1 and EL0, N is the value in MDCR_EL2.HPMN if EL2 is using AArch64, or in HDCR.HPMN if EL2 is using AArch32. Otherwise, N is the value in PMCR.N.

field_value_description.para: When read, means that PMEVCNTR<n> is disabled. When written, has no effect.
When read, means that PMEVCNTR<n> is enabled. When written, disables PMEVCNTR<n>.

ps.name: MRC
MCR
